summary: Realistic Eyes is a lore friendly eye texture replacer for all races. The textures have a resolution of 1024x1024.
descriptionHtml:
[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]About Realistic Eyes 1.0:[/b][/size][/color]

Realistic Eyes is a lore friendly eye texture replacer for all races. The textures have a resolution of 1024x1024. I tried to keep vanilla colors, unless I could not see a clear difference.
Please read the instructions. Everything should work fine then.

[b]RE 1.0 was never finished, as I lost my psd-files at some point. So it never had textures eg. for orcs. I thought I should keep this textures, so anybody who likes them can use them. But keep in mind: This mod will not be continued.
You can mix and match RE 1.0 and RE 2.0 as much as you like, you can also use my RE 2.0 esp-files.[/b]

[color=green]If you like this mod please don\'t forget to endorse it. If you don\'t like it, don\'t use it. No need for bitchy comments. Constructive criticism ist welcome, though. Just stay polite ;)
Please don\'t forget: Comments and endorsements encourage modders to continue their work.

I\'m not a native speaker, but I\'ll try to help you, if I can. I can\'t answer private messages, as I\'m not registered in Nexus Forums and therefore can\'t open them. I don\'t have much time for modding, so I can\'t take requests :( There will be more stuff, when I upload some :) Please be patient.

If something isn\'t working, please just tell me and I\'ll try to fix it. Thank you :)[/color]

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1]Humans & Elves:[/size][/color]
I used a real iris for the texture. elven and human pupils got the same texture, alpha and size and I also made elven eyeballs white (found them ugly), so that it\'ll look good, if they share eyetextures.

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1]Argonians:[/size][/color]
This reptilian beastrace reminds me on raptors. That\'s the reason why I choose to give them crocodile-like iris textures, instead of a mix of gecko and crocodile. I also didn\'t like the difference between male (crocodile) and female irises (gecko). So I created three different texture packages and a esp file.

[b]\"RE 1 AddOn - Argonian FBG\":[/b]
- Female gecko pupils for male argonians
[b]\"RE 1 AddOn - Argonian MBG\":[/b]
- Male crocodile pupils for female argonians

Use only one of the argonian texture packages, as both genders are included :)

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1]Khajiit:[/size][/color]
I used my pet cat for reference :) and at the moment I won\'t change my textures for this race, as I\'m comfortable with them.

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1]Vampires:[/size][/color]
Rosie iris, white eyeball

If you want to use my vampire eye textures, please keep in mind, that
- elven races, humans and orcs share eyevampire_01.dds (and eyevampire_02.dds)
- khajiit use eyekhajiitvampire.dds
- argonians use eyeargonianvampirefemale.dds and eyeargonianvampiremale.dds
in the vanilla version of the game.

[b]\"RE 2 AddOn - Argonian FBG vampire\":[/b]
- female vampire textures for both genders
[b]\"RE 2 AddOn - Argonian MBG vampire\":[/b]
- male vampire textures for both genders

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1]Misc:[/size][/color]

If you want to use my blind eye textures, please keep in mind, that
- humans and High elves share eyeblind.dds
- Wood elves and Dark elves use eyeorcblind.dds
- orcs use eyeorcblind.dds
- khajiit and argonians share eyeargonianblindmale.dds
in the vanilla version of the game.

[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]Installation:[/b][/size][/color]

Packages should be NMM compatible, at least they have a proper file structure. This should make manual installation pretty easy too. Always make a back up of existing files if needed, please.

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]Manual:[/b][/size][/color]

1. DL the package/packages you want to use
2. Extract it/them into your data folder

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]NMM and Mod Organizer:[/b][/size][/color]

1. DL the package/packages you want to use
2. Activate it/them

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]Mixing/Customizing:[/b][/size][/color]

1. DL the package/packages you want to use eg. onto your desktop*
3. Extract it/them, browse to textures\\actors\\character\\eyes
4. Figure out, which files you want to use (see screenshots for file names) and delete the rest
5. Depending on which method of installation you usually use, the next step vary
Manual:
- Copy the files into [...]skyrim\\data\\textures\\actors\\character\\eyes
NMM: 
- Create a new archive and load it into NMM
Mod Organizer:
- Create a new archive and load it into Mod Organizer or
*- install the mod first -> right click -> open in explorer -> browse to textures\\actors\\character\\eyes and customize here

[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]Uninstallation:[/b][/size][/color]

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]Manual:[/b][/size][/color]

1. Browse to textures\\actors\\character\\eyes in your data directory
2. Delete every RE texture

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]NMM:[/b][/size][/color]

1. In your Mod list: Search for the RE folder
2. Deactivate the Mod
3. Delete the Mod

[color=LightSteelBlue][size=+1][b]Mod Organizer:[/b][/size][/color]

1. In your Mod list: Search for the RE folder
2. Deactivate the Mod
3. Delete the Mod

[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]Last Update:[/b][/size][/color]

[color=LightSteelBlue]26 October 2012:[/color]
- Seperated RE 1.0 from RE 2.0. Too many archives and more to come. Confusing for you and very annoing for me.

[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]Distribution Permission:[/b][/size][/color]

You may NOT redistribute this mod in any way or claim it as your own.
If you want to use this textures in a compilation, please ask first.

[color=LightSlateGrey][size=+2][b]Credits:[/b][/size][/color]

[b]Screenshots[/b]
BellaGail - Better Females
Caliente - Calientes Female Body Mod Big Bottom Edition
Caliente - Darker Neater Brows
author: Yunfei
